courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Frontiers in Biochemistry

meetings.instructor: Dr. NGAI Hung Kui,   Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin,   Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky,   Professor TSANG Suk Ying,   Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

Dr. NGAI Hung Kui,   Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin,   Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky,   Professor TSANG Suk Ying,   Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

Dr. NGAI Hung Kui,   Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin,   Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky,   Professor TSANG Suk Ying,   Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

Dr. NGAI Hung Kui,   Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin,   Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky,   Professor TSANG Suk Ying,   Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

courses.description: This course presents the latest developments and advancements in biochemistry and molecular biology. It aims to alert students the trends and recent breakthroughs in biochemical and biomedical research. Contents will vary from year to year.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Fundamentals of Biochemistry

meetings.instructor: Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai

courses.description: The course introduces the fundamental principles of biochemistry that are essential for all life science disciplines. It covers the importance of water, structure-function relationships of biomolecules (including amino acids, proteins, carbohydrates, lipids and nucleic acids), the biochemical logic of the metabolic pathways, and an overview of metabolism with emphasis on how biomolecules interconvert into each other.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Research Internship

meetings.instructor: Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos
Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos

courses.description: This course is designed to allow students to gain practical experience in scientific research in a laboratory or biotechnology firm during the summer period or term time. All research or internship projects, locally or overseas, must be approved by the School.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Methods in Biochemistry

meetings.instructor: Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor KONG Siu Kai,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky
Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor KONG Siu Kai,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky
Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor KONG Siu Kai,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky
Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor KONG Siu Kai,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky

courses.description: This course aims at introducing quantitative analyses of biochemical reactions and subcellular components to students. Methods for purification and studies of biomolecules will also be introduced. Techniques including chromatography, gel electrophoresis, centrifugation, fluorescent spectrophotometry and microscopy will be covered. The use of radioisotopes and non-radioactive labelling methods will also be included.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Proteins and Enzymes

meetings.instructor: Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping
Professor FONG Wing Ping

courses.description: Three-dimensional conformations of proteins and protein folding will be discussed with emphasis on structure-function relationships. Basic concepts of proteomic techniques and the investigations of protein structures will be covered. Enzyme catalysis will be introduced with respect to coenzyme requirements, kinetics, catalytic mechanism and regulation of enzymatic activities.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Molecular Biology

meetings.instructor: Professor SHAW Pang Chui
Professor SHAW Pang Chui
Professor SHAW Pang Chui
Professor SHAW Pang Chui

courses.description: This course discusses basic areas of molecular biology, including characteristics of DNA and RNA, genomic elements, DNA replication, transcription, translation, mutation, repair, gene regulation and epigenetics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4010 or BIOL2310.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Recombinant DNA Techniques

meetings.instructor: Professor SHAW Pang Chui
Professor SHAW Pang Chui
Professor SHAW Pang Chui

courses.description: This course covers the basic concepts of recombinant DNA techniques, including restriction and modification enzymes and their applications in recombinant DNA techniques, analyses of nucleic acids, insertion of DNA fragment into prokaryotic and eukaryotic vectors and transformation of model organisms and expression of recombinant proteins.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4020.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Bioenergetics and Metabolism

meetings.instructor: Dr. NGAI Hung Kui
Dr. NGAI Hung Kui
Dr. NGAI Hung Kui

courses.description: This course covers basic concepts of how biological organisms obtain energy and perform metabolism to build different biomolecules. The following biochemical processes underlying energy transformation in living organisms will be discussed: photosynthesis, glycolysis, citric acid cycle, electron transport, oxidative phosphorylation, fatty acid oxidation. Biosynthesis of carbohydrates, lipids, nucleic acids, and proteins will be provided. The integration of metabolic pathways will also be discussed.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Self-study Modules in Biochemistry
courses.description: Students will study special biochemical topics on their own, under the supervision of a faculty member. Each student is required to make oral presentations and submit short written reports. In so doing, students will also develop general self-learning skills.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE3092. Pre-requisite: BCHE2000.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Self-study Modules in Biochemistry and Professional Development

meetings.instructor: Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon,   Professor SHAW Pang Chui

courses.description: This course aims to enhance studentsâ€™ abilities and competence in information search, critical reading and analysis, and communication in biochemistry. In addition, transferable skills and strategies for professional development necessary for career entry and for a sustainable satisfying career are also our emphases. Through different course activities, students should also be able to develop their generic skills in collaborative teamwork, problem solving, and peer-assessment.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE3090. Pre-requisite: BCHE2000.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Chemical Biology
courses.description: The discipline of chemical biology is focused on the application of chemical principles, particularly organic chemistry, to the study and manipulation of biological systems. Two major focus areas include the development of chemical tools to proteins and cells, and in the identification and creation of novel compounds as therapeutics for the treatment of human disease. The course will begin with a brief review of organic chemistry fundamentals and bio-orthogonal ligand reactions. It will then cover case studies to illustrate the power of chemical biology to solve important problems at the chemistry-biology interface.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 and one of the following three courses: CHEM1070 or 1072 or 1280.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Molecular Biology and Recombinant DNA Laboratory

meetings.instructor: Dr. NGAI Hung Kui
Dr. NGAI Hung Kui
Dr. NGAI Hung Kui

courses.description: This laboratory course is the first part of the consecutive experimental training aims at providing hands-on experience in the basic techniques in biochemical research. A set of experiments to illustrate various molecular biology and recombinant DNA techniques will be performed. These include recombinant DNA construction and characterization, DNA sequencing and analyses, DNA authentication, gene expression study. Students are preferred to attend BCHE3050 and BCHE3070.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4610.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Analytical Biochemistry Laboratory

meetings.instructor: Dr. NGAI Hung Kui
Dr. NGAI Hung Kui

courses.description: This laboratory course is the second part of the consecutive experimental training aims at providing hands-on experience in the basic techniques in biochemical research. This laboratory course is a continuation of the BCHE3650 course providing basic training in biochemical techniques. Students will learn the application of different biochemical methods in the qualitative and quantitative analyses of biologically active molecules.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE3630. Co-requisite: BCHE3030.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Clinical Biochemistry

meetings.instructor: Dr. LO Fai Hang,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. LO Fai Hang,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. LO Fai Hang,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. LO Fai Hang,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. LO Fai Hang,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. LO Fai Hang,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. LO Fai Hang,   Professor KONG Siu Kai

courses.description: This course presents the basic principles in clinical biochemistry and its methodology. Tests of functions will be described.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Aspects of Neuroscience

meetings.instructor: Professor CHOW Hei Man,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai
Professor CHOW Hei Man,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai

courses.description: This course will discuss the structure and components of nervous tissue in relation to its functions. Aspects of metabolism special to the nerve and brain will be examined. These include energy metabolism, water and electrolyte balance, exchanges between blood and brain, and between brain and cerebrospinal fluid, neurotransmitters and modulators, nutrition and development of the nervous system, neuroendocrinology and the biochemistry of mental diseases.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Basic and Applied Immunology

meetings.instructor: Dr. KOON Chun Alex,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. KOON Chun Alex,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. KOON Chun Alex,   Professor KONG Siu Kai
Dr. KOON Chun Alex,   Professor KONG Siu Kai

courses.description: This course aims at providing students with the essential concepts of basic and applied immunology. Topics to be covered include architecture and development of the immune system, antigens and antibodies, immunoglobulin genes and diversity, the major histocompatibility system and T cell receptors, tolerance and autoimmunity, and integration of immune responses. The effector mechanisms of the immune system will be introduced, with special emphasis on the role of innate and acquired immunity in health and disease. The relationship of immunology to clinical problems of infectious disease, immunodeficiency, hypersensitivity, transplantation and cancer will be discussed. The applications of immunology to modern medicine and biotechnology, including vaccination, monoclonal antibody production and antibody engineering will also be covered. Students are advised to take BCHE2030 or equivalent before taking this course.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Management and Accreditation of Biochemical Laboratory

meetings.instructor: Dr WONG Yuen Ting,   Dr. CHOI Pui Wah,   Dr. YEUNG Hiu Yan,   Dr. YEUNG Shu Ying,   Professor CHO Chi Shing,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai,   Professor LEE Chi Ming
Dr WONG Yuen Ting,   Dr. CHOI Pui Wah,   Dr. YEUNG Hiu Yan,   Dr. YEUNG Shu Ying,   Professor CHO Chi Shing,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai,   Professor LEE Chi Ming
Dr WONG Yuen Ting,   Dr. CHOI Pui Wah,   Dr. YEUNG Hiu Yan,   Dr. YEUNG Shu Ying,   Professor CHO Chi Shing,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai,   Professor LEE Chi Ming
Dr WONG Yuen Ting,   Dr. CHOI Pui Wah,   Dr. YEUNG Hiu Yan,   Dr. YEUNG Shu Ying,   Professor CHO Chi Shing,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai,   Professor LEE Chi Ming

courses.description: This course is to prepare our students with the necessary knowledge and skills for career development and to meet the future demands in the biomedical industries. Core knowledge such as basic concepts and skills of laboratory management, safety and quality assurance in biochemical laboratories will be introduced. Special topics in biochemical testing, manufacturing process, good laboratory practice, laboratory accreditation, and validation of experimental protocols and methods will also be discussed. Part of the class will be taught with MSc students under different course code and assessment scheme.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BBMS6300. Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Biochemistry for Forensic Sciences

meetings.instructor: Dr. LAM Yiu Man,   Mr. TSUI Hong Teng,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai,   Professor SHAW Pang Chui

courses.description: This course aims at introducing various biochemical principles and techniques for forensic analysis to the students. Students will learn how to observe, collect, analyze and evaluate evidence found at crime scenes. The first part addresses the identification of biological fluids such as blood, semen, and saliva from crime scene. The emphasis will be on the biochemical technologies used in the presumptive and confirmatory tests. The second part covers DNA analysis using RFLP and PCR-STR typing methods, interpretation of DNA typing results, and court presentation of such biological evidence. Mitochondrial DNA typing and Y chromosome DNA typing will also be discussed. It is anticipated that students will apply the biochemistry knowledge they have acquired in junior years in the course. In addition to the core academic knowledge, various in-class activities will also be integrated for students to appreciate the importance and to apply the knowledge they have learnt in class. Teaching takes place in the evening. Part of the class will be taught with MSc students under different course code and assessment scheme.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite: BCHE2030 or permission of instructor.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Biochemistry for Sport and Exercise

meetings.instructor: Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang

courses.description: This course aims at introducing various biochemical aspects of sports and physical activities of human beings to the students. The course will cover fundamental sports physiology and basic anatomy; major proportion of the lectures will be dedicated to designated topics related to the biochemical aspects of sports and physical activities, such as energy utilization, neuro-muscular control, nutrition and fat cell biochemistry, fatigue and recovery, traumas and therapeutics, principles of doping, etc. Lectures will be supplemented with discussions and presentations.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Molecular Endocrinology

meetings.instructor: Dr. Erika KWEK,   Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. Erika KWEK,   Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. Erika KWEK,   Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. Erika KWEK,   Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. Erika KWEK,   Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. Erika KWEK,   Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. Erika KWEK,   Dr. LO Fai Hang

courses.description: This course describes the chemical structures and biological functions of hormones in vertebrates with special emphasis on human subjects. The evolution of hormonal regulation in vertebrates, as compared with neural control, will be discussed. The organization and operation of different hypothalamus-pituitary-peripheral endocrine gland axes will be discussed. Emphasis will be placed on the molecular aspects of endocrine action. Current advances in molecular endocrinology techniques will be introduced. Students are advised to take BCHE2030 or equivalent before taking this course.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Aspects of Neuroscience Laboratory
courses.description: This course consists of a set of experiments to illustrate various biochemical techniques for the study of neurochemistry. Students are advised to take the lecture course BCHE4040 simultaneously.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Immunology and Haematology Laboratory

meetings.instructor: Dr. LO Fai Hang

courses.description: This laboratory course serves to provide students with basic training in immunological and haematological techniques at both the molecular and cellular levels. Various aspects and practical applications of the methodology in immunochemistry, cellular immunology and molecular immunology will be illustrated. Students are advised to take the lecture course BCHE4060 simultaneously. This course is similar to the BCHE4660 Basic and Applied Immunology Laboratory offered in 2014 or before.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4660.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Medical Biochemistry Laboratory

meetings.instructor: Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang
Dr. LO Fai Hang

courses.description: This course aims at introducing the principles and applications of medical biochemistry. In addition to theories, diagnostic tests for various biochemical parameters in different specimens; as well as the typical techniques of diagnostic microbiology will also be covered.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Senior Experimental Project I
courses.description: In this course, students carry out an independent laboratory research project either provided by the supervisor or jointly decided with the student. To fulfill the course requirement, students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors regularly and submit a research proposal.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4910. Pre-requisite: BCHE3090 or BCHE3092.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Senior Experimental Project II

meetings.instructor: Professor Benoit THIBODEAU,   Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin,   Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos,   Professor CHEN Sijie,   Professor CHEN Zhefan,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky,   Professor WONG Kam Bo,   Professor ZHUANG Xiaohong

courses.description: Students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisor(s) regularly and submit a progress report at the end of the term. For student who will not be enrolled in BCHE4903, a final report in the form of a manuscript and an oral presentation are assessed at the end of term for performance.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4910. Pre-requisite: BCHE3090 or BCHE3092.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Senior Experimental Project III

meetings.instructor: Professor Benoit THIBODEAU,   Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin,   Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos,   Professor CHEN Sijie,   Professor CHEN Zhefan,   Professor LAU Kwok Fai,   Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky,   Professor WONG Kam Bo,   Professor ZHUANG Xiaohong

courses.description: In this course, students continue to work on and finish up the research project from BCHE4902. Relevant data analysis and conclusion formulation are performed after discussion with supervisors. A final report in the form of a manuscript and an oral presentation are assessed at the end of term for performance.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4910. Pre-requisite: BCHE3090 (or BCHE3092) & BCHE4902.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Group Research in Biochemistry
courses.description: This course is a capstone course consists of group projects to investigate the heated topics related to Biochemistry, such that students will be inspired by how Biochemistry has made its impact on the globalized knowledge-based society of Hong Kong.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE4902 or LSCI4000. Pre-requisite: BCHE3090 or BCHE3092.

courses.subject: BCHE
courses.title: Seminar
courses.description: Students shall be required to present the results of their research to their peers and staff.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Biochemistry
